code.text: if (20 > 18) { println("20 is greater than 18") }

code.text: if (condition) { // block of code to be executed if the condition is true } else { // block of code to be executed if the condition is false }
code.html: if (condition) { // block of code to be executed if the condition is true } else { // block of code to be executed if the condition is false }

code.text: val time = 20 if (time < 18) { println("Good day.") } else { println("Good evening.") } // Outputs "Good evening."
code.html: val time = 20 if (time < 18) { println("Good day.") } else { println("Good evening.") } // Outputs "Good evening."

code.text: if (condition1) { // block of code to be executed if condition1 is true } else if (condition2) { // block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is true } else { // block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is false }
code.html: if (condition1) { // block of code to be executed if condition1 is true } else if (condition2) { // block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is true } else { // block of code to be executed if the condition1 is false and condition2 is false }

code.text: val time = 22 if (time < 10) { println("Good morning.") } else if (time < 20) { println("Good day.") } else { println("Good evening.") } // Outputs "Good evening."
code.html: val time = 22 if (time < 10) { println("Good morning.") } else if (time < 20) { println("Good day.") } else { println("Good evening.") } // Outputs "Good evening."

code.html: val time = 20 val greeting = if (time < 18) { "Good day." } else { "Good evening." } println(greeting)

code.text: val day = 4 val result = when (day) { 1 -> "Monday" 2 -> "Tuesday" 3 -> "Wednesday" 4 -> "Thursday" 5 -> "Friday" 6 -> "Saturday" 7 -> "Sunday" else -> "Invalid day." } println(result) // Outputs "Thursday" (day 4)
code.html: val day = 4 val result = when (day) { 1 -> "Monday" 2 -> "Tuesday" 3 -> "Wednesday" 4 -> "Thursday" 5 -> "Friday" 6 -> "Saturday" 7 -> "Sunday" else -> "Invalid day." } println(result) // Outputs "Thursday" (day 4)

code.text: var i = 0 while (i < 10) { println(i) i++ if (i == 4) { break } }
code.html: var i = 0 while (i < 10) { println(i) i++ if (i == 4) { break } }

code.text:
var i = 0 while (i < 10) { if (i == 4) { i++ continue } println(i) i++
}
code.html:
var i = 0 while (i < 10) { if (i == 4) { i++ continue } println(i) i++
}

code.text: fun myFunction() { println("I just got executed!") }
code.html: fun myFunction() { println("I just got executed!") }

code.text: fun main() { myFunction() // Call myFunction } // Outputs "I just got executed!"
code.html: fun main() { myFunction() // Call myFunction } // Outputs "I just got executed!"

code.text: fun main() { myFunction() myFunction() myFunction() } // I just got executed! // I just got executed! // I just got executed!
code.html: fun main() { myFunction() myFunction() myFunction() } // I just got executed! // I just got executed! // I just got executed!

code.text: fun myFunction(fname: String) { println(fname + " Doe") } fun main() { myFunction("John") myFunction("Jane") myFunction("George") } // John Doe // Jane Doe // George Doe
code.html: fun myFunction(fname: String) { println(fname + " Doe") } fun main() { myFunction("John") myFunction("Jane") myFunction("George") } // John Doe // Jane Doe // George Doe

code.text: fun myFunction(fname: String, age: Int) { println(fname + " is " + age) } fun main() { myFunction("John", 35) myFunction("Jane", 32) myFunction("George", 15) } // John is 35 // Jane is 32 // George is 15
code.html: fun myFunction(fname: String, age: Int) { println(fname + " is " + age) } fun main() { myFunction("John", 35) myFunction("Jane", 32) myFunction("George", 15) } // John is 35 // Jane is 32 // George is 15

code.text: fun myFunction(x: Int): Int { return (x + 5) } fun main() { var result = myFunction(3) println(result) } // 8 (3 + 5)
code.html: fun myFunction(x: Int): Int { return (x + 5) } fun main() { var result = myFunction(3) println(result) } // 8 (3 + 5)

code.text: fun myFunction(x: Int, y: Int): Int { return (x + y) } fun main() { var result = myFunction(3, 5) println(result) } // 8 (3 + 5)
code.html: fun myFunction(x: Int, y: Int): Int { return (x + y) } fun main() { var result = myFunction(3, 5) println(result) } // 8 (3 + 5)

code.text: fun myFunction(x: Int, y: Int) = x + y fun main() { var result = myFunction(3, 5) println(result) } // 8 (3 + 5)
code.html: fun myFunction(x: Int, y: Int) = x + y fun main() { var result = myFunction(3, 5) println(result) } // 8 (3 + 5)

code.text: class Car { var brand = "" var model = "" var year = 0 }
code.html: class Car { var brand = "" var model = "" var year = 0 }

code.text: // Create a c1 object of the Car class val c1 = Car() // Access the properties and add some values to it c1.brand = "Ford" c1.model = "Mustang" c1.year = 1969 println(c1.brand) // Outputs Ford println(c1.model) // Outputs Mustang println(c1.year) // Outputs 1969
code.html: // Create a c1 object of the Car class val c1 = Car() // Access the properties and add some values to it c1.brand = "Ford" c1.model = "Mustang" c1.year = 1969 println(c1.brand) // Outputs Ford println(c1.model) // Outputs Mustang println(c1.year) // Outputs 1969

code.text: val c1 = Car() c1.brand = "Ford" c1.model = "Mustang" c1.year = 1969 val c2 = Car() c2.brand = "BMW" c2.model = "X5" c2.year = 1999 println(c1.brand) // Ford println(c2.brand) // BMW
code.html: val c1 = Car() c1.brand = "Ford" c1.model = "Mustang" c1.year = 1969 val c2 = Car() c2.brand = "BMW" c2.model = "X5" c2.year = 1999 println(c1.brand) // Ford println(c2.brand) // BMW

code.text: class Car { var brand = "" var model = "" var year = 0 } fun main() { val c1 = Car() c1.brand = "Ford" c1.model = "Mustang" c1.year = 1969 }
code.html: class Car { var brand = "" var model = "" var year = 0 } fun main() { val c1 = Car() c1.brand = "Ford" c1.model = "Mustang" c1.year = 1969 }

code.text: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) }
code.html: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) }

code.text: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) val c2 = Car("BMW", "X5", 1999) val c3 = Car("Tesla", "Model S", 2020) }
code.html: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) val c2 = Car("BMW", "X5", 1999) val c3 = Car("Tesla", "Model S", 2020) }

code.text: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) { // Class function fun drive() { println("Wrooom!") } } fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) // Call the function c1.drive() }
code.html: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) { // Class function fun drive() { println("Wrooom!") } } fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) // Call the function c1.drive() }

code.text: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) { // Class function fun drive() { println("Wrooom!") } // Class function with parameters fun speed(maxSpeed: Int) { println("Max speed is: " + maxSpeed) } } fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) // Call the functions c1.drive() c1.speed(200) }
code.html: class Car(var brand: String, var model: String, var year: Int) { // Class function fun drive() { println("Wrooom!") } // Class function with parameters fun speed(maxSpeed: Int) { println("Max speed is: " + maxSpeed) } } fun main() { val c1 = Car("Ford", "Mustang", 1969) // Call the functions c1.drive() c1.speed(200) }

code.text:
// Superclass
open class MyParentClass { val x = 5 } // Subclass class MyChildClass: MyParentClass() { fun myFunction() { println(x) // x is now inherited from the superclass } } // Create an object of MyChildClass and call myFunction fun main() { val myObj = MyChildClass() myObj.myFunction() }
code.html:
// Superclass
open class MyParentClass { val x = 5 } // Subclass class MyChildClass: MyParentClass() { fun myFunction() { println(x) // x is now inherited from the superclass } } // Create an object of MyChildClass and call myFunction fun main() { val myObj = MyChildClass() myObj.myFunction() }

fun main() {
println("Hello World")
}

code.text: fun main() { println("Hello World") }
code.html: fun main() { println("Hello World") }
